pages.title: Crafting
pages.text: Floppy Disks can be played using a Broadcaster block. The Broadcaster can play one Floppy Disk at a time and works similarly to a Jukebox.

pages.title: Usage
pages.text: To use the Broadcaster insert a written Floppy Disk in the disk slot. Once the Floppy Disk is inserted the Broadcaster will attempt to load the MIDI file from the Disk MIDI URL.$(br2)If the MIDI file loads successfully it will begin transmitting just like if it were coming from your transmitter.$(br2)The Broadcaster screen will show the instruments that the file has assigned to each MIDI Channel just like the Transmitter.$(br2)

pages.title: Connecting
pages.text: To connect an instrument to the Broadcaster and start hearing the music, first connect a Switchboard by right-clicking the Broadcaster while holding the Switchboard.$(br2)Once the Switchboard is connected insert it into an instrument and enable the desired MIDI Channels.

pages.title: Error Messages
pages.text: If you receive an error message when loading the Floppy Disk into the Broadcaster you may need to try a different MIDI URL. The error message should explain the particular error and what you might need to do to correct it.$(br2)MIMI allows servers to restrict which websites may be used for Floppy Disks or disable all websites. If you get an error that the website you used is not allowed talk to a server Admin to find out which, if any, are allowed.$(br2)
